result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert J Marquez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert J Marquez in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Robert J Marquez.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for a deferred prosecution agreement hearing. The DPA offer from the State is no longer available due to the defendant moving out of town. Court will be set case on trial calendar. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse. Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Marquez in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case remains in DPA posture.  Court granted defense request for a new date in Branch 13.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Marquez in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert J Marquez appeared by video means with Attorney. Based on defendant's appearance in court by zoom, Court cancels stayed bench warrant. Defendant to schedule TAD evaluation.   Court ordered case adjourned for deferred prosecution agreement hearing in Branch 37.  All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Sam Obscherning in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: MK.
Case in Court for pretrial conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Case remains calendared in Br. 37.  Calendar call scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Josephine L G or Alicia E R.

Defendant Robert J Marquez in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Robert J Marquez in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert J Marquez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
